, &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RsOg89tBXno/UlqQpuw3gmI/AAAAAAAAmS4/1sa2W6lonSE/s1600/images.jpgHYR4HJ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"477\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RsOg89tBXno/UlqQpuw3gmI/AAAAAAAAmS4/1sa2W6lonSE/s640/images.jpgHYR4HJ.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></span></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">If the child is healthy\n, with environmental experience, &nbsp;from\nbirth to the age of three the number of neural &nbsp;connections multiplies by 20. &nbsp;&nbsp;In the past, it was commonly thought that\nintelligence was 80% genetic and 20% environmental. &nbsp;Today we know that the reverse is true . It is\nnow thought to be 20% genetic and 80% environmental with genes and experience\nbeing interdependent. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">This is why a\nchild in a desert is lesser brain developed than an Indian child brought up in\na jungle with variety of flora and fauna.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">An infant\u2019s brain is not fully\ndeveloped at birth, and he needs sensory input for the cells to build and\nconnect.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The brain develops and\norganises its function in direct response to the pattern, intensity and nature\nof sensory and perceptual experiences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The child\u2019s brain is\nspecially primed for learning . Axons and dendrites are plentiful, creating a\nsynaptic network &nbsp;that can capture many\nnew experiences.&nbsp; Brain metabolism, as\nmeasured by blood sugar consumption, remains high. &nbsp;So does a healthy child\u2019s energy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">While it is possible to\nlearn new skills at any age, it is easiest to learn between the ages of 3 and\n8. &nbsp;One dramatic example is language:\nchildren sometimes seem like sponges soaking up new words, both in the family\u2019s\nprimary language and in others they regularly hear.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">It &nbsp;is easier for people to learn second languages\nbefore the age of 8 than after. &nbsp;&nbsp;Do you\nas an intelligent adult wish to take on a child of 8 in learning a foreign language\n? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The brain plays closer\nattention to things that don't fit an established pattern, things that are new\nand different. &nbsp;The brain reacts to\nroutine mundane stimulus by lowering levels of stimulation. That is why mothers singing the same boring lullaby\nday after day, will quickly lull their infants to sleep. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Since piano &nbsp;music is more complex in structure,\ninstrumentation and harmony, it primes the brain with pathways needed for other\ncognitive tasks.&nbsp; &nbsp;Musical training during early childhood helps\ncreate brain changes that can last for a person\u2019s whole life.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gcNRoJhgow8/UluEBAUIqkI/AAAAAAAAmT4/MuHyhev-hVc/s1600/brain.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"330\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gcNRoJhgow8/UluEBAUIqkI/AAAAAAAAmT4/MuHyhev-hVc/s400/brain.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></span></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">It is the brain and\ncentral nervous system that hears. The inner ear cochlea is filled with liquid.\nMicroscopic hairs called cilia project out into this liquid and they release a\nchemical neurotransmitter when stimulated. &nbsp;Neurons are brain cells, and you have billions\nof them in your head and spinal cord.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Neurons \u201ctalk\u201d to one\nanother electrically through specialized connections called synapses.&nbsp; The axon is the part of the neuron that\ncarries electrical impulses away from the cell body.&nbsp; At the end of the axon, there are specialized\nendings where the electrical signal gets transferred onto the dendrites of another\nneuron.&nbsp; These are the synapses. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">In most neurons, the\naxon is wrapped up in an electrical insulator made of a substance called\nmyelin.&nbsp; Electrical impulses travel\nfaster down axons that are insulated, and so the presence and amount of myelin\non an axon alters the neuron's ability to transmit electrical signals.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Almost\neverything that happens in our brains comes down to circuits of neurons\ntransmitting electrical signals.&nbsp; Basically\na mechanical signal is converted&nbsp; to an\nelectrical signal A sound wave is a longitudinal wave-- a series of\ncompressions and rarefactions .The wonder of the cilia hairs is that it can\nperceive 1500 levels of pitch. The number of discriminable tones in in the\nhundreds of thousands.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Below: Cilia&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Q-tXLs30A_A/Ulo7rcjgk0I/AAAAAAAAmRw/B7JDIqexNu4/s1600/imagesCAS4EAO9.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Q-tXLs30A_A/Ulo7rcjgk0I/AAAAAAAAmRw/B7JDIqexNu4/s400/imagesCAS4EAO9.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></span></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Are you not able\nto recognise the voice of a long lost friend?&nbsp;&nbsp;\nAmazing , right? The audo frequency range encompasses 9 octaves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">So when we learn\nsomething new, or get better at doing something, what happens in our brains is\nthat the neuronal circuits responsible for that fact or skill become stronger,\nbetter able to communicate with one another.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">When we learn at school\nand college and finally forget everything, you are educated. It is NOT about\nremembering . It is about making neural pathways in the brain \u2013 or for a layman\ndigging new tunnels .&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">This is where our Indian education system is found\nwanting. Education system in school should be all about digging new tunnels or\nconnecting more circuits in the brain.&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">It is NOT about knowing that the capital\nof India is New Delhi and getting 100% marks for that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Learning piano at a young\nage , helps in many ways. The synapses become stronger and so transmit the\nsignals more reliably. &nbsp;New synapses\nform, so the neurons are more strongly connected. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Myelin growth leads to faster transmission of\nthe electrical signals down the axon, and better timing of neuronal signals. &nbsp;Neurons that fire together wire together. When\nneurons fire at the same time, the connections between the neurons get\nstronger.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/Rb_xKwyfhY0/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/Rb_xKwyfhY0&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/Rb_xKwyfhY0&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Myelin is an dielectric\nor electrically insulating layer or sheath that forms around nerves, including\nthose in the brain and spinal cord.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The myelin sheath, &nbsp;grows around the axon of a neuron. &nbsp;It is essential for the proper functioning of\nthe nervous system. &nbsp;It is an outgrowth\nof a type of glial cell. The production of the myelin sheath is called\nmyelination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZaVhn5r0MbQ/Ulo2xr3XtVI/AAAAAAAAmRU/Iz-gBtRXGs8/s1600/myelin_sheath.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"230\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZaVhn5r0MbQ/Ulo2xr3XtVI/AAAAAAAAmRU/Iz-gBtRXGs8/s400/myelin_sheath.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The purpose of the\nmyelin sheath is to allow impulses to transmit quickly and efficiently along\nthe nerve cells. If myelin is damaged, the impulses slow down.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The process of\nmyelination, which begins before birth , in the 14th week of fetal development\ncontinues throughout childhood. &nbsp;&nbsp;As said\nMyelin not only protects the growing nerves, it helps them communicate better. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">The brain undertakes\nthis task in stages.</span> &nbsp;<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Those\nneural networks involved in early life skills (such as sucking and swallowing)\nare myelinated during pregnancy. &nbsp;The\nprefrontal cortex, the part of the brain involved in higher forms of learning, &nbsp;is &nbsp;NOT completely\nmyelinated until the child is 10.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">As your child starts to\ntalk, he or she activates several areas of the brain in rapid succession.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-X1zkfiPAOBo/Ulo3ftDvY8I/AAAAAAAAmRc/Nn8hSsdRGMY/s1600/Synapse.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-X1zkfiPAOBo/Ulo3ftDvY8I/AAAAAAAAmRc/Nn8hSsdRGMY/s400/Synapse.JPG\" width=\"368\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The neural networks\nthat are used grow stronger . Those that are not used wither away, &nbsp;just as unused brain cells started dying in\nthe last weeks before birth. &nbsp;This\nprocess is known as pruning. It is similar to the way a tree is pruned of deadwood\n. This pruning of excess brain cells and connections truly sculpts a person\u2019s\nbrain. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">At birth, the number of\nsynapses per neuron is 2,500, but by age two , it\u2019s about 15,000 per\nneuron. The brain eliminates connections that are seldom or never used..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Growth and pruning\ncontinue throughout our lives, but the relative balance of the processes\nchanges. &nbsp;Until your baby is 3, growth\nfar outpaces pruning. From then until the age of 10, the formation of new\nconnections is balanced by the elimination of unused ones. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">When your child reaches\npuberty, the balance finally shifts and the pruning of connections exceeds the\nformation of new ones. &nbsp;This is why\nschooling is important. &nbsp;You cannot sit\ncontent stating that I will attend school after the age of 20.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dhz4YkydAPY/Ulo7Rf-DoFI/AAAAAAAAmRo/uLF81evnbjk/s1600/early_learning1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"566\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dhz4YkydAPY/Ulo7Rf-DoFI/AAAAAAAAmRo/uLF81evnbjk/s640/early_learning1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes certain\nexperiences are even necessary to \u201cturn on\u201d genes and unlock their natural\ncoding. &nbsp;This interplay is lifelong. &nbsp;Even the brain of an adult can continue to\nrewire itself and make connections after exposure to new situations. &nbsp;The result of all this is that the brain is\ncustom-designed to function in its owner\u2019s environment. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Thus\nour human brain differs from our heart, lungs, and other organs, &nbsp;which follow a standard and predictable\ndevelopmental process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/cUGuWh2UeMk/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/cUGuWh2UeMk&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/cUGuWh2UeMk&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The neurons for vision\nbegin sending messages back and forth rapidly at 2 to 4 months of age, peaking\nin intensity at 8 months. The babies begin to take notice of the world during\nthis period. &nbsp;If a baby is NOT allowed to\nsee, or hear his brain will be stunted as an adult.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">At birth, the human\nbrain is in a remarkably unfinished state. </span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Most of its 100 billion neurons are not yet\nconnected in networks. </span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Forming and\nreinforcing these connections are the key tasks of early brain development.\nConnections among neurons are formed as the growing child experiences the environment\nand uses and receives feedback from all 5 senses .</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">An infant\u2019s repeated\nexposure to words clearly helps his brain build the neural connections that\nwill enable him to learn more words later on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Playing a piano with\nboth hands is not about skill alone but about using both brain lobes and brain communication.\n&nbsp;It &nbsp;improves the brain\u2019s ability to discern the\ncomponents of sound \u2014 the pitch, tone and frequency.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KFVo8LJou-I/UlqQdhMrWAI/AAAAAAAAmSw/tpmZZZkhGB0/s1600/9z86rwtb-1326426310.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KFVo8LJou-I/UlqQdhMrWAI/AAAAAAAAmSw/tpmZZZkhGB0/s400/9z86rwtb-1326426310.jpg\" width=\"377\" /></span></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Sound waves are\ntransformed into nerve impulses, to the temporal lobe of the cerebral cortex\nwhich is dedicated to sound. The audio range is 20 hz to 20 K Hz.&nbsp; 1 hertz is one cycle per second Cilia waves\n20000 times per sec at 20 Khz frequency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Because of the\nwidespread multi sensory integration in the human brain, learning occurs when\ndiverse brain capacities in many parts of a brain circuit are strengthened\nthrough neuroplasticity. In fact, this may be the only way we learn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Neurons actively alter\ntheir neurotransmitters with changing circumstances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Young infants must be\nkept happy. When they are faced with physical or emotional stress or trauma,\nthe hormone cortisol is released when the brain sends a signal from the\nhypothalamus to the adrenal cortex, which is a gland above the kidney. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of cortisol can cause brain cells\nto die and reduces the connections between the cells in certain areas of the\nbrain, harming the vital brain circuits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">From birth till the age\nof 8 , a child\u2019s brain forms trillions of connections or synapses. &nbsp;Axons connect to dendrites, and chemicals called\nneurotransmitters help send impulses across the resulting synapses.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Each\nindividual neuron may be connected to as many as 15,000 other neurons, forming\na network of neural pathways that is immensely complex. &nbsp;This elaborate network is sometimes referred\nto as the brain\u2019s \u201cwiring\u201d or \u201ccircuitry.\u201d &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">As the neurons mature, more and more synapses\nare made. &nbsp;At birth, the number of\nsynapses per neuron is 2,500, but by the age of three, &nbsp;it\u2019s about 16,000 synapses per neuron. The\nneural network expands exponentially. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">If\nthey are not used often , they are eliminated. Experience plays a crucial role\nin \u201cwiring\u201d a young child\u2019s brain. &nbsp;Brain\ndevelopment does not stop after early childhood, but it is the foundation upon\nwhich the brain of the future continues developing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/vyNkAuX29OU/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/vyNkAuX29OU&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/vyNkAuX29OU&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Wanna check out how\ngood your left and right brain lobe co-ordination is?</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Sit on a chair and then\nuse your left hand and left leg ( if you are a right hander ) and draw 2 feet\ndiameter anticlockwise circles in air with your forefinger and big toe.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">When you have got it\nall right and your circles are now steady , suddenly reverse the direction of\nyour hand, to clockwise.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Did your anti-clockwise\ngoing right foot, continue as before -- &nbsp;or\ndid it jerk and get confused?<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">If you had started\npiano at a young age, you will NOT fail in this test.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/e2GoGiO1h40/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/e2GoGiO1h40&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/e2GoGiO1h40&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Brain mapping shows\nthat creativity is housed in the right hemisphere of our brains &nbsp;for right handers . You can thus stimulate\nthis right brain by playing piano with the left hand. Both left and right brain\nlobes are activated when we use our non-dominant hand.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">So from tomorrow morning\nonwards tell your child to brush his teeth with his non-dominant hand, or the\nhand which he does NOT use for writing .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/RJ1gpqr0kkA/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/RJ1gpqr0kkA&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/RJ1gpqr0kkA&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The baby\u2019s brain at\nbirth is equivalent to a circuit board in a radio, ready to be plugged in and\nplayed .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">At birth, the baby\u2019s\nbrain is already one fourth the weight of an adult\u2019s, even though his whole\nbody weighs less than a tenth of an adult\u2019s. This is the marvelous result of\nthe prenatal development, when billions of neurons form, axons grow, and\nsynapses start to connect the neurons.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The brain adds\ncomparatively few cells after birth. &nbsp;Instead,\nthe existing neurons grow larger and more powerful, sprouting axons and\ndendrites and connecting with neighbors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In the first year, the baby\u2019s brain triples in\nweight. &nbsp;By the end of the second, the\nbaby\u2019s s brain weighs three quarters that of an adult\u2019s. &nbsp;The brain\u2019s activity increases with its\nweight. &nbsp;The metabolism of a baby\u2019s\nbrain, as measured by how much blood sugar it uses, builds steadily from birth\nuntil the age of 3. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">As your child starts to\ntalk, he activates several areas of the brain in rapid succession.. . The\nreason why you cannot recall memories before the age of 3 is because the parts\nof the brain necessary for recalling such memories are not \u201cwired\u201d then. The\nsynaptic connections that link the hippocampus to the cerebral cortex have not\nyet been made. These connections become circuits as the child enters preschool\nLKG. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Learning does not progress\nin a strict linear sequence like climbing stairs but instead flourishes as a\nresult of growth cycles in which a child acquires preliminary skills and then\nuses them to build new capacities based on a foundation built.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xRwK9hR-rNw/Ulp9rGl2wVI/AAAAAAAAmSA/vGQi3DqXDkQ/s1600/stages-of-brain-development-in-an-infant.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"460\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xRwK9hR-rNw/Ulp9rGl2wVI/AAAAAAAAmSA/vGQi3DqXDkQ/s640/stages-of-brain-development-in-an-infant.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Synaptic growth is\nmost&nbsp; significant during the baby\u2019s first\nfew years of life\u2014when he &nbsp;is taking in\nall sorts of new sensory inputs and acquiring new experiences and skills. By\nthe time your child turns 3, each neuron has formed as many as 10,000\nconnections, making a total of about a quadrillion (1,000,000,000,000,000)\nthroughout the brain. &nbsp;This is double the\nnumber of connections in your own adult brain.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Synapse formation slows\nafter the toddler years, &nbsp;but continues\nthroughout childhood and into adolescence, finally reaching adult levels when\nyour child is around 16 years old. &nbsp;Even\nthe brain of an adult can continue to rewire itself and make connections after\nexposure to new situations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Musical fingering\nability opens up about age 4.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://img.youtube.com/vi/rZsvX3SAQeE/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/rZsvX3SAQeE&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://youtube.googleapis.com/v/rZsvX3SAQeE&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The CNS has two kinds\nof tissue: grey matter and white matter, Grey matter, which has a pinkish-grey\ncolor in the living brain, contains the cell bodies, dendrites and axon\nterminals of neurons, so it is where all synapses are. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">White matter is made of\naxons connecting different parts of grey matter to each other. Many of these\nnerve fibers (axons) are surrounded by a type of fat called myelin. The myelin\ngives the white matter it's color. Myelin acts as an insulator. It plays an\nimportant role in the speed of nerve signaling as I have said before .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Neurons constitue about\nhalf the volume of the CNS and glial cells make up the rest.&nbsp; Glial cells provide support and protection\nfor neurons.&nbsp; They are thus known as the\n\"supporting cells\" of the nervous system.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The four main functions\nof glial cells are: to surround neurons and hold them in place, to supply\nnutrients and oxygen to neurons, to insulate one neuron from another, and to\ndestroy and remove the carcasses of dead neurons (clean up).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The brain\u2019s ability to\nadapt in response to environmental stimuli, throughout life, is termed\nplasticity. The first five years matter and last a lifetime.&nbsp; The brain develops through use. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The musicians who began\nplaying an instrument before age 7 demonstrate more accurate timing and their\nbrains also indicated more enhanced white matter in the corpus callosum..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_Nhdtrt5_fo/UlqIwOr5qTI/AAAAAAAAmSQ/a4VK1JpinyM/s1600/images.jpgk6o6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"216\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_Nhdtrt5_fo/UlqIwOr5qTI/AAAAAAAAmSQ/a4VK1JpinyM/s400/images.jpgk6o6.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The corpus\ncallosum&nbsp; is the largest connective\npathway in a human brain.&nbsp; It is made of\nmore than 200 million nerve fibers that connect the left and right side lobes\nof the brain. &nbsp;To coordinate movement or\nto think about complex information, the hemispheres must communicate with each\nother.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o-dbYxyfGQI/UluH5cFsQ3I/AAAAAAAAmUM/k1OT2DjZLr8/s1600/CorpusCallosum222-258x300.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o-dbYxyfGQI/UluH5cFsQ3I/AAAAAAAAmUM/k1OT2DjZLr8/s640/CorpusCallosum222-258x300.jpg\" width=\"552\" /></span></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">The corpus callosum is the main connector that allows that communication.<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">. </span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">It is through the neural connections of the\ncorpus callosum that the two hemispheres work together for conscious wholeness.</span><span style=\"line-height: 115%;\">.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Albert Einstein had a\ncolossal corpus callosum ( sic ) </span>.</b> &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-shoTajA4XKI/UlrOhCIJSWI/AAAAAAAAmTQ/h1d4OyNjJwM/s1600/Corpus_callosum.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"256\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-shoTajA4XKI/UlrOhCIJSWI/AAAAAAAAmTQ/h1d4OyNjJwM/s640/Corpus_callosum.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></span></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">The corpus\ncallosum carries electrical signals between the brain\u2019s right lobe and its left\n.&nbsp; They think that white matter cleaving Einstein\u2019s\n&nbsp;brain from front to back , is part of\nwhat made Einstein\u2019s mind so phenomenally creative (&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">propaganda</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;).</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0bl9LL9r1YE/UlqNPL-xgXI/AAAAAAAAmSk/PO4qjmkJ_A0/s1600/1192963-bigthumbnail.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"240\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0bl9LL9r1YE/UlqNPL-xgXI/AAAAAAAAmSk/PO4qjmkJ_A0/s320/1192963-bigthumbnail.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></span></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Einstein\ncontinued to exercise his brain strenuously ( though affected by&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">syphilis</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;) , like our own Ram Jethmalani ,&nbsp;&nbsp;forestalling much of the brain atrophy that\ncomes with age.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Grace and peace !</b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OwGj3R-ly8Y/UlKoSHxxvXI/AAAAAAAAmL0/aW-3HZ8lk7Q/s1600/images.jpggyjtrfjnm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OwGj3R-ly8Y/UlKoSHxxvXI/AAAAAAAAmL0/aW-3HZ8lk7Q/s400/images.jpggyjtrfjnm.jpg\" height=\"369\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have a \u201cAdivasi\nbeauty\u201d Mala Kishoendajal telling the world in her novel \u201cDame Blanche\u201d about\nSindoor as follows :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; <i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the Middle Ages Muslims kidnapped Hindu\ngirls and raped them. As a mark of this rape they applied sindoor in the\npartition of hair of the victims. Somewhere in the 13<sup>th</sup> century, a\nclever Brahmin got a bright idea to mislead the Muslims. &nbsp;From their birth &nbsp;the sindoor was applied at the partition of\nthe hair of the girls. &nbsp;This way it was\nnot &nbsp;possible for the Muslims to find out\nwho was raped and who was not</span></i> : UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large;\">TEE HEEEE !</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This pea brained Indian\nHindu woman is from Suriname and now settled down in Holland.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I would suggest that\nshe learns her own tribal&nbsp; family history\nfirst , before she ventures into writing lies about cerebral topics like Hindu\nculture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I can help her with her\nown history.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BJV-qa7fxTU/UlKsNXiRmkI/AAAAAAAAmMA/i9adBjOQ3rU/s1600/Mala+Kishoendajal.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mala baby , nay madame ,\npunch into Google search-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">THE INDENTURED COOLIE,\nSLAVERY REINVENTED VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having read that you\nmust know that 9000 year old figurines dug up at Mehrgarh in Balochistan ( part\nof India ) have revealed sindoor on hair parting and on forehead. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Islam is just 1400 years old.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the west there is a &nbsp;wedding ring to tell you someone is married. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India , Hindu women\nshow a vermilion dot on the forehead and a line on the hair parting above the\ndot ( see first picture ) to show that they are married and the husband is\nstill alive. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sindoor on the parting\nin the bride's hair is first applied by the bride groom as a part of the\nwedding ceremony. &nbsp;After that the bride\nputs it on her own every day after a bath, till she becomes a widow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Widows can continue to\nwear the black bindi ( dot ) but with a white sari. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">When the married woman\napplied the sindoor on her hair parting everyday, she remembers her husband\nwith gratitude . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern sindoor mainly\nuses vermilion, which is an orange-red pigment. &nbsp;Vermilion is the purified and powdered form of\ncinnabar, which is the chief form in which mercury sulfide naturally occurs. &nbsp;As with other compounds of mercury, sindoor is\ntoxic and must be handled carefully.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every day when a Hindu\nwoman applies sindoor on her hair parting after a bath, she remembers her\nhusband with gratitude.&nbsp; It is a mark of\ndevotion , acceptance , maturity and dependency . &nbsp;In Hindusim marriage is a life long\ncommitment, and there is a sense of belonging.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">This is a daily pledge\nof honour and chastity. &nbsp;Grateful women\nhave memories stored inside their hearts .&nbsp;\nGratitude is the most beautiful and fragrant flower, in the garden of her\nsoul. &nbsp;This ritual keeps her mentally\nhealthy and happy. She is less stressed and happier with social relationships .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The area where sindoor is\napplied is between the eyebrows, called the Ajna Chakra. &nbsp;This is the point that Sanatan Hindu Dharma\nconsider the entry and exit point of our jivaatma (soul).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I challenge &nbsp;the world\u2019s greatest hypnotist and let him try\nto hypnotize a Hindu woman with bindi dot on her forehead. &nbsp;He can try till the cows come home, he wont be\nsuccessful. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This area if called the\nthird eye of Shiva. &nbsp;Applying the bindi signifies\nher eternal link with the Supreme being. A Hindu woman firmly believes that\nthis dot protects her from negative tendencies and forces. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
